Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stereo- \Ste"re*o-\ [Gr. stereo`s solid. See {Stare} to gaze.] A combining form meaning solid, hard, firm, as in stereo-chemistry, stereography. [1913 Webster]

stereo adj : designating sound transmission from two sources through two channels [syn: {stereophonic}, {two-channel}] n 1: reproducer in which two microphones feed two or more loudspeakers to give a three-dimensional effect to the sound [syn: {stereo system}, {stereophonic system}] 2: two photographs taken from slightly different angles that appear three-dimensional when viewed together [syn: {stereoscopic picture}, {stereoscopic photograph}]
